name: Kichanga Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent beach - perfect for a relaxing, lazy holiday. The food was average (particularly lunch) and service was sometimes excellent and sometimes a bit lacking (a mixed bag depending on who was around).
reviews.title: great location, amazing beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the balcony to the rooms, (with hammock). Nice restaurant, pool and deck.
reviews.title: A perfect wedding in paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THere was a $25 charge for wi-fi (for 3 days, unlimited) which I thought was unnecessary (everywhere else we stayed in Zanzibar it was free). Not really what you need when you just want to check emails for 5 minutes every day.
reviews.title: Fairytale setting behind palm-fringed beach - 60 steps below

reviews.text: We had a very lazy 4 days.
reviews.title: beautiful palms, white sand, relaxing, professional massage lady, excellent reception staff
Nigel - you are the best !
reviews.text: We stayed at Kichanga Lodge for a week during which we got married on the beach. The rooms are beautiful, the location was stunning but the thing that made the trip most memorable was the staff. The management, service staff, security, everyone, went to a massive effort to make sure our stay was enjoyable.

a great manager, cordial , brigth-eyed and attentiv. we felt warmly welcomed and looked after. the staff is kind and helpful. the hotel, bungalows, are great, spacious, clean, beautifully decorated and the view is fantastic. the beach is like in paradise, big, silent, coconut palmtrees. at hightide it is great to swimm, at lowtide it is perfect to collect various shells. you can even walk through the water (with shoes!) until it gets deep enough to swimm. or you can use the swimmingpool. i also liked the lobby- restaurant-bar, where there is a very familiar and pleasant athmosphere. what could be better? the water of the shower was a bit poor and sometimes not hot in the evening. but this is just a detail! thank you Nigel and staff for the wonderful time we had! jill and gedeon from switzerland
reviews.title: It is like paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secluded resort on a beautiful spot, bungalows with a splendid ocean or gardenview located in a well kept garden. Staff will do their best to make you feel at home, especially our waiter George did his utmost to accomodate our wishes. Always friendly, smiling, we missed him on his day off. Nigel, one of the owners, is the perfect host. Welcoming his guests, always interested and making you feel special. Food is in buffetform for dinner, in general good with enough choices. For lunch you can make your own choice, keep in mind that sometimes not everything is available. But that's part of Zanzibar. Beach has enough sunbeds under the palmtrees, giving natural shade and as an extra tea and coffee is served on the beach in the afternoon.
reviews.title: peaceful beautiful wonderful paradise :-)

reviews.text: If you are lucky enough to have your birthday during your stay you will be surprised by the staff. Don't forget to take a flashlight, other part of Zanzibar experience is powerfailure.
reviews.title: Excellent beach but everything else fails to live up to it

reviews.text: Even with generator backup it will be handy to have some extra light. Water at the resort is no problem as it is brought in every day.
reviews.title: Amazing place managed by amazing people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also went to the Rock for lunch, restaurant located in the sea, half an hour walk during low tide from the resort. It has the same owners as Kichanga and it serves food on a more than special, beautiful location. We had a great time doing nothing at Kichanga, but if you wish you can also make some nice excursions from here. On leaving Nigel came to say goodbye and gave us some good tips for Stonetown, our next stop.
reviews.title: I could have stayed there all my life !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the bungalows at this secluded lodge are basic and quite the opposite of luxurious, the property makes up for these shortcomings tenfold with a long and stunning stretch of hidden beach, a spotless pool, several cozy nooks for drinking, reading, and relaxing on the beach and in the lodge (or your bungalow porch), and an overly friendly staff at the ready. If you're looking for a place that has a fancy room to go back to after a day at the beach, this isn't the place. If you just need your room for showers and a good night's sleep with a hammock and beautiful views, then this is it. Take full advantage of the large property!
reviews.title: Incredible property

reviews.text: The food is worth noting, too. Lots of Italian-inspired food to go with the Tanzania fare on offer at all meals. This will be a welcomed change after a few nights on safari and/or on the beach. I believe an Italian duo manage the property with a jovial staff made up of mostly Kenyans.
reviews.title: Nice hotel on a small and very quiet beach of white sand.

reviews.text: We did some research while at Kichanga for 4 nights this September. Ras Machamvi has nicer rooms, but a boring property and no beach during high tide. Karafuu next door is massive and lacks the character of Kichanga - and comes with a beach full of hawkers selling their wares and excursions (non-existent at Kichanga). We're confident we made the right decision.
reviews.title: Loved it and we'd like to return one day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If the owners did invest a bit in the bathrooms in each bungalow, they would have a four-star property on their hands.
reviews.title: A visit is worth a thousand pictures

reviews.text: We loved first of all the location of this nice hotel: overlooking a small beach of white sand and clear blue water, with palm trees in the front and scenic sea cliffs on the sides.
reviews.title: The perfect retreat from the stress of city life

reviews.text: Dear kichanga Lodge,
reviews.title: What a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just come back from my Xmas holidays and I already miss you all very much. You have made me and all my family pass such a wonderful time and such a unforgettable holiday.
reviews.title: good location, for the rest very poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have travelled a lot in my life for business and for leisure but very rarely I have found a place like yours.
reviews.title: Beautiful place in a lonesome area, far behind the tarmac road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, the atmosphere , the staff everything is in harmony. We enjoyed very much the food , especially everything so fresh and cooked on the grill by Chumvi.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with fantastic personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I still remember sitting outside my bungalow looking at the ocean, what an incredible view you have. Looking at the fisherman pass with their local boats
reviews.title: we have found heaven on earth

description: A little resort with a private beach and beautiful charming cottages, surrounded by a luxuriant tropical garden. In perfect harmony with the natural environment, Kichanga Lodge is an unforgettable place for those who love nature and romantic atmospheres.........
